entry.value: This template generates a scatter plot colored according to a column. It also demonstrates how to use a ggplot theme to control your plot's appearance.

# This example relies on ggplot2 and grid, if these packages are not part of %%00010# your R installation, please add them!%%00010require(ggplot2)%%00010require(grid)%%00010%%00010# Insert column references here. %%00010# Note: variable names are used as plot labels ("x" will be the x axis label)%%00010%%00010x = #<Choose column from Column List>%%00010y = #<Choose column from Column List>%%00010%%00010#Column to color by:%%00010%%00010class = #<Choose column from Column List>%%00010%%00010# Use a flow variable for a title%%00010%%00010title = #<Choose variable from Flow Variable List or set manually>%%00010%%00010%%00010# define a plot theme%%00010# http://docs.ggplot2.org/0.9.2.1/theme.html for more options%%00010clean_theme = theme(panel.background = element_blank(),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009plot.title = element_text(size=20, face="bold", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009panel.border = element_rect(color = "black", linetype = "solid", fill = "transparent"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title.x = element_text(size=14, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title = element_text(size=14, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.text = element_text(size=12, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009legend.text = element_text(size=12, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009panel.grid = element_blank()%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009)%%00010%%00010# Generate a plot and apply the theme%%00010qplot(x, y, color = class, main = title) + clean_theme%%00009
